info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 29 at 7:49PM EDT until March 31 at 6:00AM EDT by NWS Gray ME
info.description:
...LONG DURATION LATE SEASON WINTER STORM CONTINUES...
.Another round of wintry mixed precipitation will gradually move north overnight. It may take the better part of the night for precipitation to reach parts of the Kennebec River Valley and Moosehead Lake region. Snow, sleet, and freezing rain are all expected at some point before precipitation comes to an end as rain showers.
* WHAT...Heavy mixed precipitation. Additional snow accumulations up to one inch, sleet accumulations around one quarter of an inch, and ice accumulations between one tenth and one half of an inch.
* WHERE...Southern Grafton County.
* WHEN...Until 6 AM EDT Monday.
* IMPACTS...Icing of trees will cause some tree branches to snap and others to be weighed down. The power outage threat is elevated to locally significant. Travel will be dangerous and is not advised due to icy road conditions.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions can be obtained by going to newengland511.org

parameter.value: WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM EDT MONDAY
